transportAdvice: Florence's historic center is compact and highly walkable, making it easy to reach most major attractions on foot. The city has a bus network and limited tram lines that serve broader areas, and taxis are readily available at designated stands throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and occasionally foggy winter days with short daylight hours and few crowds.
Still cool with occasional rain, but early signs of spring begin to appear toward month's end.
Mild and variable weather with increasing sunshine, though rain showers remain common.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming gardens and comfortable temperatures for sightseeing.
Warm and largely sunny with occasional afternoon showers; one of the most enjoyable months to visit.
Hot and mostly dry with long sunny days and growing tourist crowds.
Peak summer heat with intense sun and very high visitor numbers; early mornings are best for outdoor sightseeing.
Equally hot as July with some locals leaving the city; some smaller shops and restaurants may close.
Warm and pleasant with cooling evenings and fewer crowds than peak summer.
Mild autumn temperatures with increased rainfall and beautiful fall foliage in surrounding hills.
Cool and frequently rainy with shorter days; indoor museums and galleries are particularly appealing.
Cold winter weather with festive Christmas markets and decorations; occasional frost possible at night.
